plugins.name: Pinwheel Plugin
plugins.description:
Import Design Tokens JSON to Figma variables and Figma styles. Export Figma variables and styles to Design Tokens JSON. Use mode names to create groups for light mode, dark mode, and high contrast variants. Full support for importing and exporting sRGB and Display P3, allowing colors to maintain correct appearance when being moved from Figma to Pinwheel.


It’s a great way to transfer colors, numbers, strings, shadows, and booleans to and from Figma to Pinwheel, or anywhere that can import Design Tokens Community Group formatted JSON.


What's Pinwheel? We’re glad you asked. It’s an amazing app for managing your design system, converting between color formats and color spaces, and automating color contrast testing. If you work with design systems, Pinwheel is for you.

plugins.name: pluckpluck
plugins.description:
A plugin that just plucks everything from one side of the cursor. Great for making room for that extra page in a flow.


Right click context menu, or simplest ctrl+, cmd+, search for 'pluck'.


Known issue:

If you hold down the right mouse button as you go through the menus, the selection will be wrong, since you moved the mouse sideways. Click and release, then go through the menus.


Will only select items that are frames or layers on the canvas.


Or do the quick action menu: ctrl/cmd+,
plugins.tagline: Pick up and move. Faster.

plugins.name: Infa
plugins.description:
What is Infa

Manage your design system inventory directly within your product's webpage. Learn more at https://infa.ai/


What does the Figma Plugin for Figma unlock?

Pull all the screenshots and code snippets for your component views from Infa into FigJam. This enhances your design system review sessions by enabling visual and code comparisons of components. Navigate back to the component in your real product through our Chrome extension, ensuring that your design critiques are grounded in actual product usage.


How to Get Started:

  1. Install the Chrome Extension: Create components and select them within the Chrome Extension:https://infa.ai/chrome-extension
  2. Upgrade to Pro: Upgrade your account to Pro and upload your board to the cloud to connect your Figma plugin.
  3. Take Screenshots and Capture Code: Open component views in the Chrome Extension and click on "Take Screenshot" or "Capture Code" to make them available in your plugin.
  4. Authenticate: Open the Figma plugin and enter your API key from your Info account to authenticate. https://infa.ai/profile#api
  5. Import Components: Select the components to import screenshots and code into FigJam.


Contact Us:

For any questions or recommendations, please reach out to us at contact@infa.ai
plugins.tagline: New way of Conducting Design System Inventory and Visualizing Design System in use with Infa

plugins.name: Ecco Icon
plugins.description:
What is Ecco Icon?

Ecco Icon is a free, ever-expanding icon pack featuring both static and animated icons. This plugin allows designers to seamlessly add static versions of the icons to their Figma designs. When it’s time for development, animated Lottie versions can be downloaded from Ecco Icon website to bring projects to life.

For more customization, designers can also download the After Effects (.aep) files from Ecco Icon website to tweak colors or use them in mockups.


Is it really free?

Yes, it is! No paywalls or registration required. All icons, including animated versions, are free to use under the Creative Commons BY 4.0 license.

Thanks to your generous donations, the project continues to grow with even more icons and features!


This icon pack is created and maintained with love by Sajjad Dashti—graphic designer, product designer, and motion designer. For any inquiries, feel free to contact me at hi@sajjaddashti.ir.
plugins.tagline: Ecco Icon is a free pack with static and animated icons. Use this plugin to add them to your design.

plugins.name: Bloom
plugins.description:
Bloom

This little figma plugin helps you to create parameterized flower / star vector shape with ease.

You can explore combinations of parameters to create your own favorite shapes.


Create:

  1. Drag or click the controls to change the shape, preview in realtime on the left side.
  2. Hit "Create" button to add it on the page.


View bezier curve control points of vector shape:

Turn on the 'Show Bezier Controls' switch.


Update:

  1. Select the vector shape created by this plugin.
  2. Change parameters using controls.
  3. The 'Create' button will change to 'Update', just click it.
plugins.tagline: Create, edit dynamic flower vector shape with parameters

plugins.name: VibeGen — Generate AI Images and Capture a Vibe
plugins.description:
Bring your ideas to life — faster.


VibeGen lets you capture the *vibe* of any reference image and use it to generate something completely new, right inside Figma. Upload a reference, enter a prompt, and remix your inspiration into fresh icons, mockups, graphics, and more.


✨ Features:

  1. Upload a reference image to instantly capture its style.
  2. Generate fresh designs based on your reference's look and feel.
  3. Edit or remix prompts to explore variations.
  4. Create icons, product mockups, social graphics, and UI elements.
  5. Automatically remove backgrounds for clean assets.
  6. Designed for speed — built directly into Figma.


🎨 What you can create:

  1. Custom icons with unique styles.
  2. Fresh product mockups for marketing and UI.
  3. New takes on your own sketches, wireframes, or screenshots.
  4. Graphics that match a specific aesthetic or trend.
  5. Edited images with removed backgrounds for clean use.


🚀 Why VibeGen?

  1. Save time by starting from inspiration, not a blank canvas.
  2. Easily match styles across projects and presentations.
  3. Turn rough ideas into polished, professional visuals.
  4. Explore new creative directions without leaving Figma.


➡️ Ready to vibe?

Upload a reference image, prompt your vision, and let VibeGen handle the rest.

accepted.description: The Resonance is a brand and product studio helping startups and founders create brands, products, and experiences that resonate.

plugins.description:
Navigator is your personal navigation assistant in Figma. It allows you to bookmark up to 4 frames across your project for instant access. It supports across page access as well.


Navigator is perfect for designers working on large projects, enabling efficient navigation and improved productivity. Leap through your designs with ease and speed up your workflow today!




HOW TO:

Select a frame and click "Add Link" to bookmark it

Use the saved links to instantly navigate to your bookmarked frames

Clear individual links or all links as needed

Toggle the UI to keep your workspace clean

plugins.name: Tappy
plugins.description:
Tappy

Tappyは、Figma上で選択中のオブジェクトの大きさを取得し、それをタップする操作が成功する確率を算出するプラグインです。


使い方

Tappyのウィンドウで、iPhoneの機種名をメニューから選択してください。Figma上でオブジェクトを選択すると、指定したiPhone上に表示したときの大きさ（ピクセル単位とmm単位）、およびそのオブジェクトをタップするときの成功確率が表示されます。メニューに含まれていない画面サイズの機種を指定したい場合は、「画面の大きさ」欄に直接ピクセル数を入力してください。末尾に記載の利用規約も併せてご確認の上ご使用ください。


タップの成功確率の算出基準

タップ成功率（SR）は以下の式をもとに計算されます。

SR= erf[W/{2×sqrt(2) ×σ_x}]×erf[H/{2×sqrt(2) ×σ_y}]

erfは誤差関数、Wはボタンの横幅、Hはボタンの縦幅です。

σ_xとσ_yはそれぞれタップ座標の軸の分散と軸の分散であり、以下の式をもとに計算されます。

(σ_x)^2=α_x×W^2+(σ_ax)^2、 (σ_y)^2=α_y×H^2+(σ_ay)^2

α_x、σ_ax、α_y、σ_ayは回帰定数です。

より詳しい理論は論文(https://doi.org/10.1145/3567732)の2章と3章や、Tech Blog（https://techblog.yahoo.co.jp/entry/2021120930233778/）をご参照ください。

Tappyは 「非利き手でスマートフォンを持ち、利き手の人差し指でボタンをタップする場合」を想定しています。


Tappy利用規約

Tappy（以下「本プラグイン」といいます）のご利用に際しては、LINEヤフー共通利用規約（https://www.lycorp.co.jp/ja/company/terms/）およびプライバシーポリシー（https://www.lycorp.co.jp/ja/company/privacypolicy/）に加えて、本利用規約が適用されます。


1. 本プラグインの概要

本プラグインは、お客様がFigma上で作成しているアプリの表示画面について、当該アプリをスマートフォンで閲覧する場合における、次の事項を表示するプラグインです。

・画面上のタップできる箇所（ボタン、アイコン、ハイパーリンク等）の大きさ

・当社が別に定める基準 に従い算出した、上記の箇所に関するタップの成功確率


2.免責事項等

・当社は、本プラグインの利用または利用不能、その他本サービスに関連してお客様に生じた一切の損害について責任を負わないものとします。

・当社は、お客様が本プラグインまたは本プラグインを通じて得た情報をもって行った著作権、商標権、特許権等の知的財産権、名誉権、プライバシー権、その他法令上もしくは契約上の権利の侵害によって第三者に生じた一切の損害について責任を負わないものとします。

・当社は、お客様が本プラグインを通じて得た情報等の確実性、完全性、正確性、有用性、特定目的への適合性等について一切保証いたしません。

・当社は、お客様の本プラグインのFigmaにおける利用が、Figma社がFigmaに関して定める利用規約等に抵触しないことを保証するものではございません。必ずお客様にて当該利用規約等をご確認のうえ、本プラグインをご利用くださいますようお願いいたします。


（2024年10月7日制定）

plugins.name: [NEW] Gleef - Translate and localize with AI
plugins.description:
Designed for teams to automate translation and streamline localization tasks directly in Figma.


Key Features

  1. Time-saving AI generation: Automate translation, key naming and searching, eliminating manual tasks and reduce the time spent on localization management.
  2. Workflow optimization: Maintain clarity and consistency by adhering to your project's naming conventions while preventing duplicate keys.
  3. Project organization: Easily track translated and pending keys to keep your localization projects on schedule.
  4. Code quality: Ensure formatting consistency across your localization files for polished and professional results.


How Gleef works

  1. Import your localization files: Quickly upload your existing localization files to get started.
  2. Select source language: Choose the source language for translations, typically the language used in your Figma designs.
  3. Choose screens / frames: Select one or multiple screens you're localizing within your Figma project.
  4. Adjust translations and keys: Maintain full control, adjust translations before exporting, allowing for fine-tuning of re-used and generated keys.
  5. Export ready files: Import the new keys into your preferred localization tool or copy-paste the updated locale file directly into your IDE.


Integrate Gleef into your Figma workflow, to significantly improve your localization process, save time and ensure consistency across your global product designs.


Whether you have questions, need a hand, or just want to share your feedback, don’t hesitate to give us a call – or send us a message if that’s more your style. We're excited to help you make the most of our new tool! +33 6 44 60 97 54

plugins.name: Syncfusion® Design Tokens
plugins.description:
Syncfusion® Design Tokens: The Premier Figma Plugin for Seamless Theme Generation

The Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin offers a professional and efficient solution for translating style changes made in Figma into custom Syncfusion® themes, ready to be applied in your applications. This tool eliminates the need for manual style transfers, streamlining the design-to-development workflow.


Key Features:

  1. Custom Theme Creation: Tailor Syncfusion® component styles in Figma to align with your unique brand identity.
  2. Effortless Token Export: Export design tokens directly from Figma with ease.
  3. Seamless Integration: Utilize the exported tokens to create custom themes in Theme Studio and implement them in your applications.


How It Works:

This streamlined process involves three simple steps:

1.Customize Your Theme

Modify the styles of Syncfusion® components within Figma to reflect your brand’s identity and design requirements.

2.Export Design Tokens

Leverage the Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin to export your custom design tokens. The plugin generates two essential files:

  1. css-variables.css: This file contains CSS variables for both light and dark themes, derived directly from your Figma designs. Import it into your application alongside the component styles to implement your custom designs. For detailed usage, refer to the CSS Variables Documentation.
  2. -tokens.json: This JSON file (e.g., material3-tokens.json) includes style variables and values compatible with Theme Studio for further customization.

3. Tokens to Theme Files

This <theme-name>-tokens.json file, prefixed with the corresponding theme name, can be imported into Theme Studio for further customization. After processing in Theme Studio, you can download the updated styles file and integrate it into your application, bringing your custom themes to life.


Benefits:

  1. Efficiency: Minimize manual tasks and reduce errors by automating the design-to-development process.
  2. Consistency: Ensure a uniform appearance across your applications by aligning design and development seamlessly.
  3. Scalability: Easily adapt and reuse custom themes across multiple projects.


With the Syncfusion® Design Tokens plugin, you can bridge the gap between design and development, creating cohesive and visually stunning user experiences with ease.

plugins.description:
This internal tool is designed to match and validate tokens efficiently. Please note that it’s only supported in designated files and may not work as intended in other files.

  1. The plugin scans all layers on the current page.
  2. It identifies and highlights matching layers.
  3. It cross-checks each layer’s Variable IDs for consistency.
  4. Any missing variables will be listed for easy identification.


If you have any questions, feel free to reach out!

plugins.name: Quick Roblox UI Exporter by Solys
plugins.description:
How it Works:

  1. Name the files inside Figma you want to export as one of the keywords: 'Frame' , 'Button', 'Icon', etc
  2. Preferably use a 1920x1080 background behind your UI, for example have the settings frame UI on a 1920x1080 background, group it together and name it 'Settings'
  3. The plugin will export and auto organize, you'll receive a file with Settings screen inside, an import reference for the Settings screen and all assets needed inside. Saving you hours on big projects as you can select 20, 30 screens at once and click export!


Why You’ll Love It:


⚡ One-Click Export – Select the UI screens you want to export and click the button


📁 Neatly Organized – Auto-sorts files by screens for easy access, all stored nicely in a zipped folder


⏳ Saves Time – Focus on design, not file management & exporting


✅ Hassle-Free – Works seamlessly with any project, automatically detects UI it needs to export by it's name, if it contains following keywords in it's name the plugin will automatically export the UI as a PNG file:

Frame

Button

Icon

UI

Scroll

Line

Title

Subtitle

Captions don't matter just include the keyword into one of those UIs you made and it'll export it automatically, you also have it nicely named for easy work with importing.


🔍 Auto-Upscaled (3x) – Maintains perfect quality for Roblox imports.


📌 Import References – Each screen automatically gets an import image reference to guide the user for seamless Roblox importing.



🎯 Try it now & simplify your workflow!
plugins.tagline: Export & auto organize whole game UI projects in seconds

plugins.name: Figmattack
plugins.description:
Figmattack: Your Ultimate Figma Learning Adventure Starts Here! 🚀


Welcome to the OPEN BETA of Figmattack, the first-ever Figma LMS plugin designed specifically for designers of all levels. Whether you're just starting out or you're a seasoned pro, Figmattack offers an exciting and interactive way to sharpen your skills, take on new challenges, and grow as a designer—all within Figma!


Why Try Figmattack?


1. Gamified Learning Stages 🎮

Explore dungeons with progressively challenging stages—Easy, Medium, and Hard. Each dungeon tests your design skills with hands-on Exercise Stages, engaging Quizzes, and fast-paced Timebox Stages. It’s not just learning, it’s an adventure!


2. Personalized Onboarding

When you start, Figmattack adapts to your current level—beginner, intermediate, or expert. You’ll get personalized challenges that help you improve exactly where you need it most.


3. Curated Knowledge Base 📚

Access a handpicked selection of design resources and insights to support your learning journey. Whether you’re tackling a new concept or refreshing your knowledge, our knowledge base is there to guide you.


Coming Soon to Figmattack!


We’re in OPEN BETA, and that means new features are on the horizon:


  1. Leaderboard: Compete with other designers, track your progress, and rise to the top.
  2. Learning Paths: Follow structured paths that guide you from beginner to expert.
  3. Community Features: Join challenges, share tips, and collaborate with other designers within Figmattack.


Join the Figmattack Community on Discord!


We're constantly improving, and we want you to help shape Figmattack. If you encounter any bugs, have ideas for improvements, or just want to connect with other designers on the same journey, we’d love to hear from you!


Join Our Discord and be part of the growing Figmattack community! Share your experience, give feedback, and help us build the future of design learning together.


Get Started with Figmattack Today!


Don’t wait—join the adventure now and start leveling up your design skills inside Figma! This is your chance to experience Figmattack in its early stages, give your feedback, and watch as new features and stages are added in real-time.


Install Figmattack on Figma and dive into your first design challenge now!


Disclaimer: As we're in OPEN BETA, not all features are available yet, and there may be bugs or areas for improvement. Your feedback is crucial in making Figmattack the best learning tool for designers, so don’t hesitate to reach out and share your thoughts!

accepted.name: Sacha Perathoner
accepted.description: Looking for the perfect fit between Users Needs & Business Objectives.

plugins.tagline: Unlock your design potential

plugins.name: marketgoo copies
plugins.description:
Plugin to sync copies from Google Spreadsheet to Figma.


How it works?

  1. Create a Google SpreadSheet with two columns. The first column is the copy id, the second column the copy value.
  2. Publish the document to the web (File > Publish to the web) and copy the public URL.
  3. In your Figma document, create text layers using the ids in the Google SpreadSheet as names.
  4. Run marketgoo copies plugin and paste the public URL of your Google SpreadSheet document.
  5. All content of the text layers with the same name as the ids in the Google SpreadSheet will be updated with the final copies.
  6. After editing any copy in the Google Spreadsheet document, just run the plugin again to update the copies in Figma.
  7. Running the plugin after selecting any layer, will update only the selected text layers (instead of the whole document).


Features

  • You can use dynamic variables with the notation {{ varname }} in your copies. The plugin will ask you for the final value.
  • You can use the HTML tag <br> to force a line break.
  • Any other HTML tag will be removed in Figma, but used to detect the ranges of all styles in the a text layer. For example: Hello <strong>world</strong>.
  • The "Reset layer names" command is useful to un-sync copies to the spreadsheet document.
  • The "Get missing copies" command list all text layers whose names do not appear in the spreadsheet. Useful to discover and sync new copies.

plugins.name: popcons
plugins.description:
Popcons is a powerful Figma plugin that takes icon customization to the next level.

Unlike conventional icon libraries, Popcons allows you to instantly modify and compare different styles, just like fonts.


Once an icon is imported, you can edit, modify, and adjust it with a single button, eliminating the need for manual replacements.

With support for 6 thickness levels, 4 styles (Line, Solid, Line Color, Full Color), and 3 roundness options, Popcons provides unparalleled flexibility. Additionally, icons can be further enhanced with decorative elements to suit your design needs.


Now, icons can seamlessly adapt to your brand identity and design language.


-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Key Features of Popcons


✔ One-Click Editing – Instantly modify icons and compare different styles, just like fonts

✔ 6 Thickness Levels – Easily adjust the weight to fit your design

✔ 4 Styles –

* Line – Clean and minimal outline style

* Solid – Bold and filled for strong emphasis

* Line Color – Customizable stroke color for additional versatility

* Full Color – Vibrant and expressive icon style

✔ 3 Roundness Options – Adjust corner roundness to match your aesthetic

✔ Decorative Additions – Enhance icons with additional design elements

✔ Seamless Figma Integration – A smooth, intuitive workflow for designers



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


How Can You Use Popcons?


* UI/UX Design – Maintain a consistent icon style across web and mobile apps

* Brand Identity – Adjust icons to align with your brand’s design system

* Presentations & Infographics – Visually compelling icons for effective communication

* Developer Collaboration – Keep icons flexible and adaptable within a design system

* Quick Style Testing & Comparison – Instantly switch between styles and compare different options



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Why Choose Popcons?


* Font-Like Customization – Modify icons dynamically without replacing them

* Time-Saving Workflow – Instantly compare and apply different styles with a single click

* Design Consistency – Ensure uniformity across your project with structured customization

* Highly Flexible – Adapt icons to fit various use cases effortlessly



-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Popcons – Make Your Icons Pop, Instantly.
plugins.tagline: Quick & Easy editable Icon tool

plugins.name: Select Below
plugins.description:
This plugin selects all objects below the selected object. It is useful when creating vertically long web designs, such as when you want to add a section in the middle.


・Targets only objects within the same parent frame

・You can exclude objects with specific layer names or objects that exceed a specified width from the selection in the settings.

・同じ親フレーム内のオブジェクトのみをターゲットにします

・設定で、特定のレイヤー名のオブジェクトや、指定した幅を超えるオブジェクトを選択対象から除外することができます。

plugins.name: Wheel of Random
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you spin a customizable wheel of fortune and randomly select one of the values you define. It’s perfect for running design sprints, choosing ideas, assigning tasks, or simply having fun during team activities.


You can enter any custom list of options — names, categories, priorities — and the wheel will visually animate the selection. The selected result can optionally appear on the canvas as a text object or styled label.


Ideal for design teams, workshop facilitators, educators, and anyone who needs a playful way to randomize decisions inside Figma or FigJam.
plugins.tagline: Spin the wheel and pick a random result — perfect for decision-making, games, and workshops.

plugins.name: Section Marker
plugins.description:
Section Marker streamlines your design process by allowing you to instantly insert labeled frames onto your canvas. With a simple UI, you can select predefined frame sizes and headings to create clear sections within your projects. Ideal for organizing content, marking boundaries, or drafting layouts, Section Marker adds a descriptive heading to each frame for easy navigation and reference. Use Section Marker to keep your design process organized and efficient.


Features:

  • Insert labeled frames with a single click.
  • Customize frame sizes to fit your design needs.
  • Enjoy a minimal and intuitive user interface.
  • Save time with quick-access options for common frame types.


How to Use:

  • Select the type of frame from the plugin UI.
  • Click 'Create' to add the frame to your canvas.
  • Drag the frame to your desired location or let it auto-position at your viewport's center.
plugins.tagline: Instantly insert and label section frames in your designs.

plugins.name: SF Symbol Generator
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin to generate static or variable SF Symbol SVGs from your Figma icons that can be imported into the SF Symbols App or directly to Xcode as an asset.

Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and up.


Features

- Convert a single Figma icon to an SF Symbol SVG

- Create variable SF Symbols from three icons (Ultra Light, Regular, and Black)

- Simple interface for selecting icons and assigning weights

- Dynamic attribution in SVG exports with plugin name and version

- Compatible with SF Symbols 5 and later versions

- Smart naming based on parent component or frame names

- The icons width will also be respected in the SF Symbol SVG accordingly

- Interactive SVG Preview with path direction visualization


Usage

1. Select one or more icon layers in your Figma document

2. Open the SF Symbol Generator plugin

3. Click "Scan Selected Icons" to detect your selected icons

4. Choose between Static or Variable mode:

- Static: Select one icon from your selection to create an SF Symbol

- Variable: Assign your icons to Ultra Light, Regular, and Black weights

5. Click "Create SF Symbol" to generate your SF Symbol SVG

accepted.name: Dustin K
accepted.description: A product designer based in Berlin, creating a powerful creative editor at IMG.LY.

plugins.tagline: Generate custom "static" or "variable" SF Symbols directly from Figma.

plugins.name: Generators & Sync Styles
plugins.description:
Create and Synchronize Local Color and Text Styles


Effortlessly create local color styles from selected frames and rectangles, while also generating global text styles from selected text layers. This plugin streamlines your design process by ensuring consistency across your project.


How it Works:


Selection: Simply select any frames, rectangles, or text layers within your Figma document.

Style Generation: Run the plugin to automatically generate local color styles based on the fill colors of the selected objects. For text layers, global text styles will be created based on the selected text properties.


Synchronization: The plugin intelligently synchronizes identical elements by matching both colors and text styles. Any duplicate styles will be updated accordingly, maintaining a cohesive look throughout your design.


With a clean interface and efficient workflow, this plugin enhances your design efficiency and style management.


Important!

The name of each color style will match the corresponding layer name, while the name of each text style will correspond to the selected text layer name. You can use a "/" in either layer name to organize your styles into groups. All styles will be arranged from largest to smallest based on their size.
plugins.tagline: Effortless style creation and synchronization for your designs!

plugins.name: Masonry tidy up
plugins.description:
A simple plugin to help get the brain waves flowing as you synthesise sticky notes from workshops or brainstorming sessions.


Key features:

  • Scale sticky notes to all be the same width and the text size will scale too, no more randomly large or small sticky notes causing havoc when trying to align things nicely ✨
  • Control how many sticky notes wide you want your tidied bundle to be
  • Set the spacing between sticky notes when they're tidied, and manually adjust this using the built in pink-line spacing tools native to FigJam
  • See the width of your selection so that you can control how the notes will tidy
  • Keep things fresh and explore different perspectives - the order of the notes will randomly change each time, so you're not stuck reading the same top notes from the same person each time you go to synthesise a new group of notes


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

☕️ If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
plugins.tagline: Tidy up sticky notes into a masonry layout

plugins.name: IconAutomation
plugins.description:
### **Comprehensive Guide to the IconAutomation Figma Plugin**


#### **Introduction**


**IconAutomation** is a powerful tool designed to streamline and automate the process of publishing icons within Figma. By integrating with GitLab CI, this plugin ensures your icon sets are always up-to-date and consistent across all platforms. Whether you're a designer working on a small project or part of a large team managing complex design systems, IconAutomation saves time and effort while eliminating manual workflows.


This plugin is primarily tailored for enterprise scenarios. Our company aims to build an internal icon library using Figma and GitLab as a replacement for Iconfont, which suffers from the following limitations:


- **Management Complexity**: Managing Iconfont requires multiple accounts and frequent importing/exporting between design files, Iconfont platforms, and code repositories.

- **Icon Accumulation**: Over time, unused icons accumulate and are loaded all at once in projects, preventing on-demand loading.

- **Font-Based Limitations**: Font-based icons may render blurry or pixelated on high-resolution screens.

- **Icon Conflicts**: Conflicts can arise when using multiple Iconfont libraries, leading to incorrect icon displays.


IconAutomation addresses these issues by leveraging SVGs to build a scalable internal icon library. Once configured, updating both the icon library and code repository can be done with a single click. Unlike font-based solutions, SVGs enable granular control over icon usage—only the icons actually used in a project are bundled, preventing unnecessary bloat.


#### **Core Features**


- **One-Click Publishing**: Publish icons directly from Figma with a single action.

- **GitLab Integration**: Seamlessly connect with GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated workflows.

- **Version Control**: Automatically manage semantic versioning in `package.json`.

- **Diff Generation**: Compare current and historical icons to generate detailed change reports.

- **Branch Automation**: Create feature branches, submit merge requests (MRs), and clean up temporary branches automatically.

- **SVG Optimization**: Optimize icon assets for performance using industry-standard tools.


#### **Prerequisites**


- **GitLab Instance**: A deployed GitLab instance (cloud-based or self-hosted).

- **Template Repository**: Deploy the `react-icons` template repository to your GitLab instance.

- **Figma Client**: Install the IconAutomation plugin via Figma's Community portal.

- **Plugin Configuration**: Configure essential settings as outlined below.


#### **Configuration Guide**


##### **GitLab Settings**


- **Domain**: The URL of your GitLab instance (e.g., `https://gitlab.com`).

- **Project ID**: Found under your repository’s **Settings > General**.

- **Access Token**: Generate a token with `api`, `read_repository`, and `write_repository` scopes from GitLab’s **Profile > Access Tokens**.


##### **Figma Plugin Setup**


1. Install the plugin and grant necessary permissions.

2. Navigate to the plugin settings and input your GitLab domain, project ID, and access token.

3. Validate the connection to ensure seamless integration.


#### **Design Specifications**


##### **Page Naming Conventions**


- Pages intended for publishing **must** include the keyword "icon" (e.g., `product-icons`, `system-icons`).

- Only frames under these pages will be processed by the plugin.


##### **Frame Requirements**


- Frames must be named with one of the following suffixes:

- **Outlined**: For icons with stroke-based designs (e.g., `Navigation-Outlined`).

- **Filled**: For solid-filled icons (e.g., `Actions-Filled`).

- **Colored**: For multi-color icons, further categorized as:

- **Light**: Optimized for light backgrounds.

- **Dark**: Optimized for dark backgrounds.


##### **Icon Layer Rules**


- All icons **must** be Figma components (not frames or groups).

- Verify component status by selecting a layer—the top panel should display "Component."


##### **Naming Standards**


- Use **Upper Camel Case** (e.g., `AlertCircle`, `SettingsGear`).

- Append style suffixes (e.g., `AlertCircleOutlined`, `SettingsGearFilled`).

- Avoid special characters (`-`, `_`, spaces) and numeric suffixes unless intrinsic to the icon’s name (e.g., `Star1` is allowed; `Star 1` is invalid).

- Ensure uniqueness within each category to prevent conflicts.


#### **Automated Workflow**


1. **Repository Setup**: Configure GitLab details in the plugin settings.

2. **Local Validation**:

- The plugin checks for naming compliance, duplicates, and structural errors.

- Invalid icons are flagged with actionable feedback.

3. **Branch Management**:

- A temporary branch (e.g., `figma-update-20231001`) is created from `master`.

- Semantic versioning updates `package.json` (e.g., `1.2.0` → `1.3.0` for minor changes).

4. **Diff Analysis**:

- Compares current icons against the latest `master` commit.

- Generates a report detailing additions, modifications, and deletions.

5. **Asset Export**:

- Exports SVGs via Figma’s API and organizes them into folders (e.g., `/outlined`, `/filled`).

- Applies SVGO optimizations to reduce file size.

6. **Merge Request (MR)**:

- Submits an MR with a standardized title (e.g., `[Figma]: add icons`).

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
plugins.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

- Auto-merges after passing CI checks (linting, build tests).


#### **Best Practices**


- **Consistent Naming**: Adhere strictly to naming conventions to avoid validation failures.

- **Modular Design**: Build icons as reusable components with standardized dimensions (e.g., 24x24px).

- **Version Tracking**: Maintain a `CHANGELOG.md` to document icon updates and deprecations.

- **Performance Checks**: Audit SVG complexity to ensure optimal rendering (e.g., simplify paths for small icons).


#### **Example Scenarios**


##### **Scenario 1: Updating an Icon Set**


1. Add new icons to the `Actions-Filled` frame in Figma.

2. Run the plugin to validate and generate diffs.

3. Submit an MR to deploy changes to production.


##### **Scenario 2: Migrating Legacy Iconfont Icons**


1. Import existing Iconfont SVGs into a `Legacy-Outlined` frame.

2. Use the plugin to publish them as SVGs and update project imports.


#### **Troubleshooting**


| Issue | Solution |

| ------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |

| **Naming Errors** | Check for invalid characters or duplicates using the plugin’s validation tool. |

| **Merge Conflicts** | Resolve conflicts manually in GitLab before re-running the plugin. |

| **API Timeouts** | Increase timeout thresholds in GitLab CI settings or split large icon sets. |

| **SVG Rendering Issues** | Convert strokes to outlines and simplify complex paths in Figma. |


#### **Future Roadmap**


- [ ] **GitHub Integration**: Support publishing to GitHub repositories.

- [ ] **Change Preview**: Display a summary of icon changes before publishing.

- [ ] **Enhanced Error Handling**: Provide contextual error messages with resolution steps.

- [ ] **Progress Tracking**: Add a visual progress bar for long-running tasks.


#### **Additional Resources**


- **Figma Documentation**: [Figma Help Center](https://help.figma.com)

- **GitLab CI/CD Guide**: [GitLab CI/CD Documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/)

- **Community Support**: Join discussions on Figma’s [Community Forum](https://forum.figma.com).
122759.tagline: This is a plugin that combines Figma + GitLab to achieve automated publication of an icon library.

plugins.name: Paint Mixer - Try for FREE
plugins.description:
Paint Mixer allows you to blend two colors just like in real life, using Kubelka & Munk algorithm to predict how light interacts with mixed pigments under natural light for the most authentic results. Learn More from this video.


Features

  1. Accurately mix two colors using the Kubelka & Munk theory.
  2. Apply the mixed color as a fill or stroke to Figma layers.
  3. Create a 9-step gradient layer and linear-fill layer from the start and end colors.


How to Use

  1. Select the end color from the palette box below.
  2. Rotate the handle clockwise to gradually mix the start color with the end color. Rotate counterclockwise to unmix.
  3. Click the hex code to copy color.
  4. Hover on the dropdown to show more actions (see image 2).
  5. Double-click one of the palettes to change its color.


Tips

  1. Rotate two full revolutions (720°) to completely turn into the end color.
  2. Click 3 dots at the bottom to show more options.
  3. Grabbing the handle further from the center of the wheel gives you more precise control.


Pricing

  1. 10 free actions with full access to all features. Actions include using the mixed color and opening the plugin.
  2. Unlock unlimited access for a one-time purchase.


Credits

  1. This plugin uses spectral.js to handle color mixing which is licensed under the MIT License.
  2. Inspiration from Paper app for iPad.
plugins.tagline: Realistic color blending using Kubelka-Munk theory

plugins.name: sticky-color-counter
plugins.description:
Count the number of stickies by color.

Able to calculate the product by giving each color sticky a unique coefficient.

The sum of the product can be viewed.


The following colors of stickies have their own coefficients by default.

  1. blue: 0.5
  2. green: 1
  3. yellow: 2
  4. red: 3
  5. else: 0
plugins.tagline: Count the number of stickies by color.

plugins.name: Flow Text Into Components
plugins.description:
“Flow Text Into Components” is a convenient Figma plugin designed to help you easily update text across multiple components in your design projects. This plugin simplifies the process of populating text into components, allowing you to save time and maintain consistency in your designs.


How to Use:


1.Set the text layer names in the master component and ensure the layer names in the instances match.


2.Prepare the text you want to flow into the components, separated by line breaks.


3.Open the plugin and select the group of components where you want to flow the text.


4.Enter the text you want to flow into the plugin.


5.Press the Update button.


If the plugin does not function as expected, check that the layer names in the master component and the instances are aligned. The plugin will not work if the layer names in the instances are inconsistent.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill components with the right text

plugins.name: Paster
plugins.description:
Access advanced pasting functionality with the ability to paste multiple layers simultaneously.


Features

  1. Paste or move layers inside a different frame, maintaining their original positions.
  2. Swap selection with copy, preserving the selection properties.
  3. Replace selection with copy, inheriting the copy properties.
  4. Paste only the properties that matter.


Available properties

  1. Absolute position: supports pasting only x or y.
  2. Auto layout
  3. Corner radius
  4. Effects
  5. Fills
  6. Interactions
  7. Name
  8. Opacity
  9. Rotation
  10. Position (relative): supports pasting only x or y.
  11. Size: supports pasting only width or height
  12. Strokes
  13. Text characters


Soon

  1. Layout grids
  2. Resizing options, like Hug and Fill.
  3. Constraints
  4. Font properties: #TBD
  5. Blend modes
  6. Export settings


Shortcuts

You have to assign them, and it works only on macOS.

  1. Control–Command-C: Copy selection
  2. Control–Command-V: Paste in place
  3. Shift-Control–Command-V: Move in place
  4. Control–Command-S: Swap with copy
  5. Control–Command-R: Replace with copy


Notes

  1. Paste strokes will ignore mixed stroke caps (e.g. rounded + arrow)
  2. Triggering undo after using 'Replace with copy', will prevent the plugin from closing. Reported to Figma - waiting for a solution.
  3. "View logs" is an experimental features available only to "Replace with copy".
plugins.tagline: Choose the properties you want to paste
